attributes.action: Make casinos check all visitors against a database to protect problem gamblers.
attributes.additional_details: For example, Leicester Square's Empire Casino has feeble checks on entry. The only time and ID is required is when a large (>£300 or so) withdrawal is made. For a problem gambler, this is not sufficient protection in my opinion.
attributes.background: At present, a problem gambler is able to ask a casino to self-exclude but there is virtually no enforcement until a withdrawal is made. This allows casinos to benefit from gambling addicts' deposits and limit their downside exposure.
